content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic clear cell carcinoma of bladder with liver metastases

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
Previous DVT 2020

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD
Apixaban 5mg BD

Allergies:
None reported

Current situation:
Newly diagnosed March 2024

Imaging findings:
CT 15/3/24 - 5.2cm bladder mass with 3 liver metastases (largest 3.8cm segment 7)
MRI liver 20/3/24 - confirms 3 liver lesions, no additional disease
Bone scan negative

Pathology:
TURBT 10/3/24 - Clear cell carcinoma, PPARG rearrangement positive

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent diagnosis of metastatic bladder cancer. He is currently PS 1 with mild fatigue but maintaining normal activities. Main symptoms are intermittent visible haematuria and right upper quadrant discomfort. Weight stable. Examination shows mild right upper quadrant tenderness but no other significant findings.

I have discussed treatment options including standard chemotherapy with gemcitabine/cisplatin versus potential targeted therapy given the PPARG rearrangement. We have agreed to proceed with chemotherapy initially given the symptom burden, with consideration of targeted agents at progression. He understands the aims are to control rather than cure the disease.

Plan is to arrange PICC line insertion next week, baseline cardiac echo and proceed with cycle 1 gemcitabine/cisplatin. Will review after first cycle and arrange CT assessment after 3 cycles. I have provided written chemotherapy information and emergency contact details.
